Adzman
A Meta is a group of up to 20 (used to be 40) players who play together in towns, and organise themselves by means outside the game, whether that is IRC, a forum or another means.

On february 9, 2012
Foam
Let me rephrase, rather than me getting random invites and not knowing the difference between the coalitions, give me reasons why I should join yours, or what should be expected of me if I do, etc.

Not sure you're going about this the right way.

It's your responsibility to take the initiative.

Ideally it functions similar to a job interview. That is, you:

a) Research to find out what metas you'd like to join
b) Figure out which seems to be the best fit for you, both in skills and personality/etc
c) Talk to someone in this meta and express your interest
d) Ask this person how to apply and what the qualifications and expectations are, etc.
e) THEN you have a two-way discussion about things.

On february 9, 2012
Foam
A coalition is 5 people and is supported within the game. A Meta is a group of several coalitions that coordinate their activities outside of the game (web forum, irc, etc., hence "Meta") so that the people in those coalitions play together, strategize together, etc.

I would suggest to keep playing and make friends via your town message boards until you find people you enjoy playing with. Then you can invite those people to a coalition via the game and continue playing together. I'd also suggest checking out die2nite.net for Meta groups and this thread for info on what groups of people are looking for people.

On may 27, 2012
Rivaan

Currently looking to take part in a coalition, and ultimately a meta. I have 13 hero days left, and plan on buying more before I run out. I want that camera! I'm currently working on the BIA skill.

I check in several times a day, and usually coach newer players on the basic mechanics of the game (not as an expert, just the common sense stuff). I also use the forums to motivate, and have often helped to inspire a town to get serious about working as a unit.

I hunger for knowledge, and read the wiki and the forums often. I believe that having a well-established communication system, along with clear cut objectives and proactive planning are the keys to surviving as long as possible.

I am very literate and avoid using text-speak like the plague. I also tend to see the bigger picture in whatever I am involved in. In D2N, I see the massive potential for wringing out the most entertainment value for your buck.

My favorite job so far is the Technician, using my CP to help accelerate construction/workshop operations. I am always willing to explore other jobs, as I have previously played as a Survivalist.

I've got some progressive ideas that can add more role-play elements, such as an established town council, chain of command, a justice system, turning the forum into a newspaper, assigned jobs, and even new job classes that can operate outside the scope of the game programming (don't worry, no hacking or exploits involved).
